issue.title: [Python] Import error (ppc64le) - Illegal instruction (core dumped)
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14323](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14323). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
## Description

The bug occurs when Installing the PyArrow library with Conda.

After trying to import with Python, this error shows up:

 
```java

Illegal instruction (core dumped)
```
 
## Environment
 \* Platform: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2 (Ootpa) - PPC64le
 \* Python version: 3.6
 \* PyArrow version: pyarrow - 5.0.0 - conda-forge/linux-ppc64le::pyarrow-5.0.0-py36h7a46c7e_8_cpu

## Steps to reproduce the bug

Installing with Conda and then trying to import the package through Python gives the error. 

``
```java

conda create --name pyarrow_py36 python=3.6
conda activate pyarrow_py36
conda install pyarrow
```
``

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14323?focusedCommentId=17428906) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Can you try under gdb to at least get a backtrace of where exactly the crash occurs?
You can do this using:
```Java

gdb --args python -c "import pyarrow"
```

Then under  gdb type "run", it will exhibit the crash, then type "bt" to get a backtrace.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14323?focusedCommentId=17428907) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Also cc `[~uwe]` since this is using the conda-forge packages.
